metadata.title: CVE-2017-16536 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The cx231xx_usb_probe function in drivers/media/usb/cx231xx/cx231xx-cards.cin the Linux kernel through 4.13.11 allows local users to cause a denial ofservice (NULL pointer dereference and system crash) or possibly haveunspecified other impact via a crafted USB device.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16536` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-119-generic - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-4.4.0-119-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-4.4.0-119-lowlatency - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-119-generic - 4.4.0-119.143
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1086-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1086.94
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1088-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1088.93
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-aws - 4.4.0-1054.63
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1013-azure - 4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1014-gcp - 4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1020-kvm - 4.4.0-1020.25
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1030-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1007-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-119.143').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1086.94').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1088.93').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1054.63').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1020.25').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1008.10').
